Problem Statement:
Users have reported that the cursor within the TextInput component of the Composer does not stay fixed while scrolling on Android devices in the Expensify app.

Root Cause:
The root cause may involve the ScrollView that contains the TextInput component. It could be altering the focus state of the input or causing the cursor to reset due to scroll events. Additionally, gesture handlers within the app might be inadvertently affecting the cursor position.

Proposed Solution:
To mitigate this issue, I suggest modifying the ScrollView and gesture handling within the Composer component. The ScrollView should have a ref assigned to it, allowing for programmatic control over its scrolling capability. When the TextInput is focused, scrolling should be disabled to prevent any movement that could disrupt the cursor position. Conversely, when the TextInput loses focus, scrolling should be re-enabled. The keyboardShouldPersistTaps prop should be set to "handled" to ensure that tapping outside the TextInput while the keyboard is open does not dismiss the keyboard and affect the cursor.

Alternative Solutions:
As an optional step, other solutions that were explored include optimizing the state and prop management within the Composer component to prevent unnecessary re-renders, as well as updating the React Native framework to the latest stable version to take advantage of improvements to the TextInput component.

By implementing these changes, we aim to provide a stable and consistent cursor position within the TextInput component, improving the user experience on Android devices. Further testing will be conducted to ensure the effectiveness of the solution and to identify any additional improvements that may be required.
